page.title: 18SAINT GUTHLAC'S CHURCH
page.content: The tiny church of Astwick is dedicated to saint Guthlac. It dates from the 11th century but the church tower is the oldest part.The church used to be much larger originally .A parish register from 1564 to 1717 still exists. The rector at present is Reverend John Andre. He is also rector at Arlesey. There is no electricity in the church so now no services are held in the winter because the only light in the church is produced by candles. There is no organ either.Hymns are accompanied on a harmonium.Central heating has only just been installed. Before,the congregation had to wear their warmest clothes!
